services.title: TECH STRATEGY
services.description: Technology play books designed for you and your operations that leverage cutting edge tech and design patterns.

services.title: SOFTWARE
services.description: Web apps, mobile apps, ERP integration, system interfaces, dashboards, maps, scraping, application modernization.

services.title: API DESIGN / DEV
services.description: Data and transactional services deployed to enable and empower your internal developers, partners, and public consumers.

services.title: DATA ANALYTICS
services.description: Get in touch with your data. Learn by automating, scaling and visualizing your metrics and make educated business decisions.

services.title: CLOUD
services.description: Take advantage of the cloud, move faster and lower your cost by taking advantage of IaaS, PaaS, and maybe even BaaS.

services.title: DEV / OPS
services.description: Operations that focus on customer satisfaction while managing and scaling your platforms as they grow with your business.

projects.title: Acquisition Visibility API Modernization
projects.description:
OSD analysts and leadership need accurate visibility to acquisition data to help them make the right decisions and ensure big dollar MDAP and MAIS programs are on budget, on schedule and meeting performance metrics. The Acquisition Visibility team
    at ARA is leading the charge of collecting,
    tagging,
    correlating and exposing important acquisition data.Collecting and mashing data from across multiple DoD silos(
      acquisition, budget, procurement),
    the team is cataloging and deploying reusable APIs to share important data resources across the Pentagon and deploying applications to give leaders the data they need to make decisions
    .
projects.quote: 540 is helping ARA define the overall API strategy and design while also developing and shipping data crawlers, data mashing APIs and visibility / visualization applications.
projects.notes: Since most of the capabilities being deployed are private in nature, we cannot show you the catalog of private APIs or the applications being developed. But if you want to see a similar approach, check out our open project at Fed {API}, which is collecting, correlating and exposing public government data sets using super cool tech such MongoDB, Elasticsearch, and Neo4j.

projects.title: Contract Line Item Wizard Tool
projects.description:
The Contract Line Item Wizard is a tool designed to provide "just in time" guidance and information (including references) to a contract writing professional on how best to structure their line item in support of PGI 204.71. The Contract Wizard
    will be a web - based tool that guides / assists users in following the rules
    for creating contract line items consistent with the type of requirement(supplies / equipment, services, etc.) and contract /
    pricing arrangement(firm - fixed price, fixed - price incentive, cost - plus - fixed - fee, etc.).
projects.quote: 540 leads the design and development of the Contract Wizard while working closely with our subject matter experts. We're using AngularJS and Amazon Web Services to build this resilient app.
projects.notes: Currently still in private beta. Once it's public, a link will be posted.

projects.title: Product Service Code Lookup Tool
projects.description: This is a web app tool designed to help users find the right PSC code based upon a taxomony / mapping provided by the DPAP office. It also provides the mapping to NAICS and OMB Object Classes.
projects.quote: <strong>540 built this tool from the ground up with lightweight APIs and UI friendly drill-downs. We love aggregating data to help your business work smarter!
projects.notes: You can view the PSC tool at www.psctool.us

projects.title: FedAPI
projects.description:
Data indexing and API platform designed to accelerate your agency's Analytics, Common Operating Pictures, Applications and Data Sharing. FedAPI was designed to organize and inform your analysts, developers and integration parters about your data
    resources.Also dynamic and consistent APIs across data resources automatically generated when data is indexed.
projects.quote: Whether you call it a common operating picture, management report or dashboard, everyone visualizes data differently, often sharing common data resources. FedAPI focuses on indexing common data resources so you don't have to.
projects.notes: You can start indexing data at www.fedapi.io

projects.title: API2Analyst
projects.description: More to come...please check back another time for more info.

projects.title: Drug Reactions Explained (DRE)
projects.description: Drug Reactions Explained (DRE) provides clear definitions to complex medical terms used to describe the adverse reactions patients have experienced when taking certain drugs (18F Agile BPA Development Prototype)

projects.title: Govicons
projects.description: Govicons is a icon font and CSS toolkit with 80 government themed icons, for easy scalable vector graphics on projects that needs government based icons. Govicons is created and maintained by 540.

projects.title: Air Hound
projects.description:
Air Hound is a lightweight application that gives you information on air quality in any location in the United States over time. The United States Environmental Protection Agency's Toxic Release Inventory feeds Air Hound information on the release of
    hazardous air pollutants identified in the Clean Air Act.Air Hound shows you the magnitude and trends of these releases over time in
    specific geographic areas.

projects.title: DoD Justification Books
projects.description: This repo contains an extract of the public DoD Procurement (P-1) and RDTE (R-1) justification book exhibits submitted by the US DoD Military Departments and Defense Agencies into multiple data formats to allow analysts / users to use their tool of choice when analyzing and/or merging with other data sources.

team_members.name: Chris Whitten
team_members.expertise: I am an experienced Software Engineer, entrepreneur and tinkerer with a love for working with people and anything data related (especially if its solving real world problems). With over 18 years experience in the IT field and starting seven of my own companies, I have had the pleasure of working at both small and large companies alike. I am truly passionate in the work I do and always strive to learn as much as I can. I love to share my knowledge and experiences with would-be Engineers and Entrepreneurs and find I have something to learn from them as well. For many years I have been a back-end systems architect and engineer, fond of and using the LAMP stack throughout most of it. I have helped private, public and government entities to be more efficient and utilize new tools more effectively. Especially lately when it comes to the Atlassian tool suite.
team_members.interests: I love to be out in the wild and exploring new trails. Whether its hiking or in a souped up 4x4, I love the outdoors and seeing something new. I also have a deep passion for business and technology, and finding new ways the combination of the two can make the world a better place.
education: University of Washington - Bachelor's degree in Computer Software Systems (CSS) - Graduated in June 2002

qa.question: What do you like about 540?
qa.answer: First off, best motto I have ever seen: "Get shit done". I really love the personalities and attitudes of everyone here. Work hard and have fun doing it. Plus, how can you not appreciate making the Government better?

Once wrote a dissassembler in assembly (Motorola 68000).
I used to be able to recite up to 150 decimals of PI from memory.

team_members.name: Christopher Bock
team_members.expertise: Starting my career in Government Contracting provided a solid functional base on which I've built my career. I'm certified at Level III in Contracting under the Defense Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act. Through my years in management consulting, I became an experienced project and people manager, leading teams of consultants delivering to clients. I've also led capture on both large (greater than $25M) and smaller deals, managing capture strategy, proposal development, and pricing.
team_members.interests: I have a passion for bringing together teams of talented, dedicated, and diverse individuals to achieve an objective. Professionally, that means tackling big Government problems and challenges through brainstorming ideas across technical and functional domains, and meshing those ideas together into an effective solution. When I worked for the Government as a Contract Specialist, I took pride in my ability to lead the charge with my business and program counterparts, finding innovative ways to achieve our mission. I like to think of myself as the glue that brought and held those teams together. That same approach applies to my consulting career. Whether we are developing a new online capability for companies doing business with the Government, or putting together a team to field a new Government subsidy program, I love bringing teams together. That passion carries over to my personal life too. I'm a founding member of a rock band that plays in the DC area, and applying our diverse musical talents to create music that people enjoy is extremely rewarding. I also enjoy organizing social gatherings with my family and friends, often centered around the dinner table or set up in a college football stadium parking lot.
education: I have a Bachelors Degree from James Madison University where I studied Marketing, and an MBA from The George Washington University with a concentration in Finance and Investments.

qa.question: What was your first Job?
qa.answer: My very first job was parking golf carts when I was 15 years old, which was fun because I got to drive before I got my driver's license. It was also fun because I got to play golf for free. My first job after college was with the Department of the Navy as a contract specialist.

qa.question: What do you like about 540?
qa.answer: An organization is only as good as its people, and 540's people are the best. Very talented, dedicated, and passionate. We can do anything we set our minds to!

qa.question: What do you do in your spare time?
qa.answer: I'm the co-founder and bass player for Lloyd Braun Band, and we typically play out on the town about once a month. I also play golf, and am an avid sports fan. On any given Saturday in the Fall, you're likely to find me tailgating at a college football game. I also enjoy cooking, and my wife and I love hosting killer parties at our house.

fun_facts: I was born in Morocco.

I'm a HUGE Pearl Jam fan (I've seen them 17 times, traded guitar picks with PJ guitarist Mike McCready from the front row at a show in Charlottesville, and met PJ front man Eddie Vedder after a show in Milwaukee).

I've visited 49 of our 50 states (Alaska is the only one left!). And for those that are wondering, layovers do not count. In my mind, to say you visited a place, you have to actually do something there. Every state has something cool to offer, but my favorites have been Montana, Washington, New Mexico and Hawaii.

team_members.name: Don Brinker

And also, there's all the various open source technologies and toolkits in the Java ecosystem (too many to track!)

I'm an API evangelist, and I'm always trying to learn new technologies and techniques for organizing and optimizing data requests (though it is difficult to keep up with all of them).

qa.question: What was your first Job?
qa.answer:
My first paying job was actually as an umpire for youth baseball at which I learned one valuable lesson (every 12-yr old kid sliding into home is safe according to their mother). My first "
          REAL" job out of college was as a Software Engineer for Dish Network (Echostar). I worked on the software that powered the set-top-boxes (STBs) that are in living rooms of Dish Network customers. I later transitioned to contribute to (and eventually lead) the team that built web-based apps that ran on Dish STBs (games, social media, news). In fact, if you have a Hopper and have ever player the BlackJack and Scrambler games, I was the primary developer for both... and I contributed and led the team on many of the other apps.

qa.question: What do you like about 540?
qa.answer: The unlimited amounts of 5hour energy and Red Bull....... oh, and the people!

qa.question: What do you do in your spare time?
qa.answer: Between work, naps, and meals.... I'm a movie guy. I watch a lot of movies/tv so that I can keep up with folks in conversations. On the weekend, you'll catch me hanging out with friends and if it's warm enough outside, I'll be getting a golfer's tan. I also enjoy yearly trips to "the beach", "the lake", and "the Vegas".

fun_facts: I scream like a little girl on "freefall-type" amusement park rides... most particularly Tower of Terror in Disney World (Orlando).
I've only seen one President in person, and that was when George W. Bush came to speak at Auburn University. He began the speech with a "War Eagle!" and the rest is history...
I went to Space Camp as a kid and had serious ambitions to become an astronaut. They told us that our generation of astronaut would get to walk on Mars...... TBD.

contract_vehicles.name: VA Advisor
contract_vehicles.description:
VA Agile Delivery of VA Imminent Strategic and Operational Requirements (ADVISOR) contract. This 5-year multi-award IDIQ is designed to assist VA programs execute cross-agency initiatives and achieve strategic priorities that
      ultimately improve outcomes
      for VA customers.

contract_vehicles.name: ATSS
contract_vehicles.description:
Providing OUSD(AT&L)(ARA) Property and Equipment (P&E) Policy Office with technical and management to support the overall goals of DoD financial transparency. Assisting the Department of Defense to improve accountability
      practices,
      increase auditability,
      and guide reporting practices and procedures.

life_list: Cool office space where we collaborate with other startups
Learning the latest tech products and approaches from each other
Startup mentality, we are all entrepreneurs
Everyone is excited about coming to work
We love to disrupt... in a good way...
perks_list: Top of the line techâ€¦. whatever you need to hack faster
Spotify account for work and play
Excellent medical, dental and vision insurance
